text: The CAMERA FLIES in over miles and miles of arid desert, nothing to interrupt the landscape except the occasional scrub brush or canyon... until it finds... . ++-about a HUNDRED TENTS AND CANOPIES, some of them quite large, squatting in the middle of nowhere. CARD: Iraqi / Kuwaiti Border, March 19, 2003 The CAMERA KEEPS FLYING until it homes in on a... INT. REC TENT —- NIGHT -+-pushing through it to find... ++-what‘s basically an open, town hall-type gathering are One soldier is holding court with a group of BRITISH OFFICERS. He is a damned good-looking man, LIEUTENANT TEMPLETON “FACE” PECK.
-+.two or three years ago. I was in Scotland outside of Glasgow at this bar called the Ivory Tick...
I was just in Glasgow and I’ve never heard of it.

Right, well, I’m getting to that... the place was owned by <his old Scottish prizefighter, Kenneth “The Haymaker” McHaymond. He was known for having a hell of a knock-out punch and he’s kind of a surly guy and I was out minding my own business with some other GIs and he tells me that he hates us Yanks and we need to get the hell out of his pub.
Sounds like my kind of guy. All the British officers start laughing. Face takes it in stride, the consummate storyteller.
tO et te eH He HH HH Ee
Anyway, me being the proud American I am, I tell him where he can take his pint of Newcastle and stuff it. The Brits laugh again, enthralled.

So this big bastard tells me he’s gonna knock me out with cne punch. “One punch?” I say, and he says “That’s right, one punch.” Well I always recognize a bet when I see one so I say to him, “Why don‘t. you put your money where your mouth is? I own the armed forces lightweight title and one thing I know this handsome face can do is take a punch. So if you knock me out with one punch I’11 pay you five-hundred dollars.” The two Brits snicker.
And what'd Mr. Haymaker wager in return if you withstood his punch?
Why do you think the pub is now named “Templeton Peck’s?” They all look at the nameplate on his uniform: Lt. Templeton Peck... and then start laughing.
That’s a true story.
(to his mates) There is a Peck’s pub there I think... Just then, an American Colonel, JOHN “HANNIBAL” SMITH, staggers up to them, a little drunk...
You're full of shit.
Whoa, easy there, Colonel. I think you've had a little too much from whatever flask you’ve tucked away.
Don’t you... .don’t tell me my business, Lieutenant. I... (MORE)
ee be ed
still outrank you and... you should know... you are full of shit. That‘s an order.
Ohhhh-kay... What say you go sleep it off? We‘re just having a friendly get-to- know-your-allies discussion here. Hannibal holds up a finger.
I guarantee I can knock you out with one punch. Face sizes him up.
Thanks... but I don’t think you’ve got a pub to name after me, so...
I'll bet you a thousand bucks. I can - knock you out with either hand.
Come on, now. You've obviously... The British officer interrupts.
I‘ll take that bet. Hannibal spins toward the officer...
You're on.
Pounds.
Fine with me. Face takes off his jacket, while Hannibal and the Brit count out the money and put it on a nearby table.
(to the Brit) You‘re gonna have to give me some of those winnings...
Half of it’s yours. Hannibal gets ready, trying to focus on Face...
* Pe oF eH ee eH
“Do you mind hitting my right side? My left’s kinda my calling card. It'd be like punching a Renoir.

Whatever. Hannibal shifts his stance to favor his left hand. Everyone waits... tension building in the room... quite a crowd is drawn. Face gets himself pumped, ready for it... for just a moment, we're not sure Hannibal’s going to be able to steady himself enough to even throw one. Then suddeniy, the colonel launches a haymaker that start from around his belt area... WHAMMM! QUICK SHOTS: Face drops. Hannibal scoops up the money. Walks out of the tent. The British officers just look after him, defeated, and we...
EXT. BARRACKS —- NIGHT Face walks down a row of barracks with an ice pack to his right jaw. A STRUCK MATCH gets him to wheel... and just then, we see Hannibal lighting up a cigar. Face smiles.
You know what they say, Face?
What's that Hannibal?
A Limey officer and his pounds are soon parted... He slaps half the money into Face’s awaiting palm.
Nice work, sir.
I love it when a plan... * + eH + + + OF
WHAMMM! The British officer they grifted steps out of nowhere to deck him with a right cross, sending his cigar flying! One of his sidekicks is right there with him...

(raging) You dirty cheating American bastards... Face doesn’t wait for more, he dives at the second Britis officer, a snarl on his mug... ...as Hannibal whips his leg around and knocks the first officer to the ground. . . he straddles the guy. and WHAM WHAM! pounds him in the face... .--just then, a LIEUTENANT sprints up, pointing at a television that is visible through a canopy..-

It's starting! It’s starting! He points at the TV and CNN is showing images of Baghdad being pounded by missiles. Face and Hannibal look up at the TV from where they are both straddling the two brits, fists cocked. Someone turn up the volume on the television...
They are calling it “Shock and Awe” as Baghdad is being bombarded...
I like that. Shock and... WHAM!!! He pounds the British officer one more time in th face... 5
(groans) Awwwww! And we FREEZE FRAME on the guy’s face as it gets knocked sideways... ...and the words THE A-TEAM splash on to the screen. Just ‘as quickly, the movie ‘resumes, and we... cur TO:
Hard-pack sand. Bleak, scorched. A BLACK SHAPE on the HORIZON turns out to be a...
Kicking up DUST. Driven by a BRIGADE MESSENGER, matching his GPS MAP to TIRE TRACKS, scratched in the earth.
The HUMVEE just stops. Precise middle of nowhere. The i MESSENGER jumps out. Checks GPS again.
(tentative) Colonel Smith? Silence, except for wind. Now he cups his mouth. COMPANY MESSENGER (CONT‘D) (shouts)

PUNCH WIDE. RISING OUT of SAND. A hundred American SPECIAL FORCES. From their most perfect hiding places. Full desert camouflage. FACES ‘Striped with grease. Hannibal strides over till he’s in the Messenger’s face. Whites of his eyes WIDE behind face paint.
(soft, tense) Kinda loud, corporal.

General Garner is sending a Chinook for you, sir. Hannibal squints. SOUND CUE: WHOMP-WHOMP of massive CH-47 rotors. They both look UP as the SOUND grows LOUDER. PUNCH TO: U.S. RANGER UH-60 BLACKHAWK (MOVING FAST) — DAY A dozen RANGERS in the HOLD. HANNIBAL, beside the PILOT. A MONITOR streams LIVE VIDEO of GENERAL HENRY ‘HANK’ GARN (64), cropped gray hair, golf tan, blue eyes.
(VIDEO STREAM)
We’re getting creamed with chatter about looting when we take Baghdad.
(wary) Okay... INTERCUT: INT. FORWARD OPERATING BASE (FOB) ‘THUNDER’ Hundreds of ANALYSTS watching dozens of live MONITORS. Showing the assault on BAGHDAD from myriad locations.
DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS, GEN. GARNER stands by a MONITOR where HANNIBAL STREAMS LIVE.

I’m gonna need you to secure the Iraqi National Museum. When you’ve established a safe perimeter, private contractors will bring in a heavy-lift chopper to take the artifacts to a protected location. Hannibal‘s eyes ice the screen.
This war’s barely started. First I had to put up with the Red Coats and now you're giving me private contractors... (beat) Sir...
Get used to it. This is a diplomatic mission. ‘Operation Friends of Liberty.’
No offense, but I‘d rather go back to securing oil fields in Basra.
Then you shouldn’t have majored in art history. Hannibal reacts.
I took one course... to impress a blonde named Elizabeth: Barbour.
How’d that. work out?
She divorced me six years ago.
Smart woman. .I pulled a team of Rangers for you. And one brilliant kid from motor pool...
An oxymoron if I’ve ever heard one.

At 30,000 feet. Hannibal joins his team as they put on HALO (HIGH ALTITUDE/LOW OPENING) equipment. HELMETS, OXYGEN tanks. Insulated SUITS. Heavy-duty PARACHUTES. Hannibal is intercepted by SGT. B.A. BARACAS (22). Steel frame. Two-percent body fat. _ BA. I’m the oxymoron, sir.

Welcome to the team, Sergeant. A violent SHAKE. Fierce GRINDING OF ENGINES. CHOPPER dips. Face is nearby. He watches B.A. shudder nervously as the chopper steadies itself again. Then he looks down at B.A.‘s hand... the man is pumping a tennis ball, almost squeezing the air right out of it. Like he’s channeling his: tension into the ball.

Afraid of jumping, sarge? B.A. turns his death stare on to Face. B.A. T'm not afraid of nothing. But until the good lord grows some wings out of my back, I’1l keep right on preferring my feet on the ground. HANNIBAL opens the HOLD DOOR. RANGERS assemble.
(shouts over the wind) (MORE )
% ob ob Ot
This is a High Altitude, Low Opening jump. B.A. doesn’t look out the door, but the tennis ball squeezing becomes even quicker. Hannibal measures him.

You will not deploy till you pass.through the enemy radar zone at two thousand feet so set your auto/open in case you lose consciousness. We will assemble below _ and move to the target. Go on green. HANNIBAL waits for a DOUBLE GREEN LCD LIGHT. Signals. Face is the first in. the window.

(to B.A.) See you in thirty-thousand feet, Sergeant. WIDEN. Face leaps out the hold door, followed by a dozen RANGERS. In ten seconds, only Hannibal and B.A. are left. B.A. is frozen, pumping that ball.
(clips onto B.A.) I'll piggy-back you down. Finally, B.A. shakes his head, defeated. B.A. I can't.

Alright, sergeant, you stay behind. B.A. relaxes, stops squeezing that ball, while Hannibal UNCLIPS. Turns away. Hannibal suddenly wraps his arms in a vice grip around B. and LEAPS FROM THE HOLD carrying B.A. OUT... INTO B.A.'S POV - A ‘HALO’ FREE FALL Dropping from the height of Mt. Everest. Resisting the urge to open a chute. They simply FALL... And FALL... And FALL... The GROUND rushing UP too fast fo the EYE to FOCUS. Too fast for the brain to comprehend. HANNIBAL holds B.A. in the tandem JUMP. CLOSER ON B.A. Mouth in a silent SCREAM. He finally PASSES OUT.

Eyes OPEN, FOCUS on a diminutive MAN with a gray goatee. REVEAL: EXT. IRAQ NATIONAL MUSEUM - PLAZA — DAY Staring down at B.A. is DR. FOUAD AL-MAHDI, the museum . director, proud, refined. B.A. is on a field litter. Atop the museum STEPS...’B.A. jumps to his feet. HANNIBAL shouts orders as RANGERS drag their chutes into the Plaza.

Double up on the perimeter. Watch the roof tops. Face, put a team on the North side. . (seeing B.A. up) Welcome back, sergeant Baracas. Ready to work? B.A. growls as Hannibal hands him an M-16 and spots a bea up CONTAINER (the trailer half of an 18 WHEELER) with Arabic graffiti being loaded with ARTIFACTS by MUSEUM STAFF. The CAB sits with some other rusty old RIGS. Hannibal’s Rangers take positions around the museum. Al- Mahdi looks openly disappointed.
Is this... all of you?
This is enough.
We cannot fit everything into one container.
Then you'll have to take what’s most valuable.

(stares, then) That would be everything. Just then, a big ass CH-47 CHINOOK, heavy-lift helicopter touches down. Painted GREEN with a CORPORATE LOGO. Feet dangling from the HOLD DOORS, like cowboys on a stage coach, are AMERICAN PRIVATE CONTRACTORS. They leap off.  11. CLOSER. Sleek hunter green body ARMOR, stitched LOGOS, like Polo shirts. : EX-SPECIAL FORCES MAJOR EDDIE PIKE (38), compact but bulk up, greets Hannibal like it’s a backyard barbecue. PIKE . Major Eddie Pike, Green Lake Security.
You sure you're still. a. major, Eddie? Pike grins, used to the attitude.
Don't underestimate us, Colonel. My boys and me were all Special Forces with combat experience.
Who now charge ten grand an hour. Pike’s smile seems to widen, if possible.
Opportunity is what separates America from this shitbox. (flicks Hannibal's
And Green Lake knows how to treat a warrior. .
Uh-huh.
Don’t téll me you haven’t thought about what’s next out there...
Oh, I've thought about civilian life.
What‘s stopping you? Hannibal turns away to move inside the museum...
Civilians. He walks...  12.
+»-and over to where Al Mahdi is gingerly lifting the cas surrounding an exquisite VASE, sparkling like a star.
I’m afraid to move it. Afraid not to. It’s more than five thousand years old.
It’s from Ur, the Babylonian city.
You know art history, colonel?
I took a class.

Cast by Nebuchadnezzar for the.Hanging Gardens of Babylon. Taken from Darius by Alexander the Great. The boy-king’s ashes were hidden inside. The Prophet himself said one day the tears of the wretched would fill the golden vase, and peace would settle on the land.
That‘'s a big story for a small vase. Al-Mahdi smiles.
We Iraqi’s love stories.
I’1l put it on myself.
This is only a display copy. He points to a small tin SEAL at the bottom.
We were afraid Saddam would steal it. We hid the real vase. A high-pitched WHISTLE. Hannibal’s instincts take over. He pushes Al-Mahdi down, covers him with his body.
Incoming. WIDEN. A MORTAR ROUND EXPLODES OUTSIDE. WINDOWS shatter.  13. HANNIBAL (CONT’D) (to Al-Mandi) Grab whatever you can. We're moving out. FOLLOW HANNIBAL, sprinting outside.
Hannibal meets Green Lake men running IN as he goes OUT. They've dropped everything by the container: statuary, rugs, stone tablets. Hannibal screams to B.A.
You spot the enemy, sergeant? B.A. Negative, sir. The same piercing WHISTLE, times three. MORTARS hit the
CLOSER. An EXPLOSION rocks the CHINOOK. Its LOADING HOLD shredded.
Fall back. RANGERS, including Face, sprint past Hannibal, waiting by the museum’s stone pillars till everyone is in. PIKE join Hannibal.
(over two-way) Air-Recon's got hostiles headed your way. And lots of them.
(two-way) I feel them, but I can't see them.
We need to get that chopper out of here fast or we’ll be stuck.
(two-way) I agree. I’m pulling you out. Hannibal looks out at all the museum’s artifacts on the ground by the CONTAINER. .
(two-way) What about ‘Friends of Liberty‘?
INTERCUT: FOB ‘THUNDER’ - TMC - LIVE MONITOR LIVE VIDEO STREAM of the attack. Garner is Hannibal’s mentor. Close as a father.
(two-way) Some things are worth dying for. ‘Art’ ain’t one of ‘em. Your mission is terminated. Get the hell out of there. PIKE, anxious, agrees whole-heartedly.
There's nothing in our contract about suicide runs.
There’s nothing in mine about dealing with assholes, but here we are. Automatic WEAPONS FIRE strafes the museum STEPS, forcing them back inside...
RANGERS lay down FIRE as the MUSEUM STAFF rushes onto the CHINOOK. Blades spinning. Hannibal spots Al-Mahdi with Face hanging back on the steps.
What the hell are you doing here?
Trying to convince DaVinci here he needs to get out while he still can...
(desperate) If I leave our heritage to the barbarians, we won't be a country anymore.
Yeah. Listen professor, either you come with us or my man here... (neds at Face) ...is going to have to stay with you and possibly get disfigured by a mortar explosion...  15.
Would you want to be responsible for disfiguring this face? The curator doesn't know how to respond.
I didn’t think so... He grabs Al-Mahdi under the elbow and leads him to the CHINOOK. . Pike is just about to close the door.
We got one more.
Sorry, we‘re full up...
Then you'll have to ride it out on the ground like the rest...
{cuts him off) Have a nice life, Colonel. Pike turns to call out...

Take her up, Andy! ...but Hannibal yanks him by the ankles where he falls right out of the chopper with a THUD... Another MORTAR ROUND explodes nearby and the GREEN LAKE CHOPPER takes off without them...
Are you out of your fucking mind? How am I gonna get out now?

I'll drive the rig. And you'll lead me out. Or else I’1l have the Sergeant here break both your legs and you can crawl out. WIDEN. B.A. drags Pike to a CAB. Throws him behind the wheel. Hannibal helps Dr. Al-Mahdi into the passenger door...  16.
Get the doctor out of here. We'll take the artifacts...
This is insane.
Insane is that ten grand an hour you charge. Dr. Al-Mahdi looks at Hannibal as he closes the door on him, desperate...
Iraq's soul is in your hands. Pike doesn't wait, drives OF7. Hannibal hurries back to his rig...
Jesus Christ... He starts to move around to the driver's side but B.A. is standing there. B.A. I'll drive.
You know how to handle a wheel? B.A. If she’s got an engine and can’t defy gravity, I can handle her.
All right then. He slides in next to Face as B.A. takes the wheel.

B.A. catches up with Pike’s CAB. Nose to bumper. Pushing the massive RIG onto a NARROW STREET. Bad combination. B.A. blasts through anything in the way. Small CARS, outdoor CAFES, VENDOR STALLS. Glances over at his mates. B.A. You men should probably buckle up.

Soon as you take your foot off the brake.  17. Pike takes a corner sharply. B.A. barely makes it. The TRAILER slams into a BUILDING. Mortar, block SHATTERS. Pike takes a second, 90 degree TURN. B.A. pulls the wheel hard. The TRUCK almost flips through the turn... A much . LARGER EXPLOSION greets them. A FIREBALL engulfs Pike's cab. Lost in BLACK SMOKE. When the SMOKE clears, Hannibal can't see them.

(into two-way) Green Lake One, come in. Over? (then) Radio‘s dead. PAN RIGHT as HANNIBAL’S WINDOW blows OUT. Hannibal ducks just in time, his HELMET showered by SHARDS. B.A. keeps plowing ahead. B.A. Where are we headed? Hannibal taps the GPS SCREEN. SHATTERED.

Find a highway south... this city’s about to be invaded. STREET OPENS into a MARKET... the RIG rams through desert STALLS, splintering WOOD... HEAVY FIRE seems to come from everywhere... They CLEAR the MARKET and find themselves headed straight for an OLD WOODEN BRIDGE, over a murky SLOUGH.
Hit the black top on the other side of the bridge. B.A. I’m too wide.

I thought you said you could drive. WIDEN. The BRIDGE comes up fast, smaller than it seemed. The RIG cracks through old beams. A TIRE EXPLODES, then ANOTHER, but B.A. keeps iz moving. ANGLE. The BRIDGE begins to COLLAPSE. The TRAILER DROPS, hanging at an angle. B.A. stomps the gas as. the BRIDGE gives way... TILT DOWN. Front TIRES just grab the other SIDE and PULL the TRAILER up and across.  18. CRANE UP. The RIG veers onto a deserted TWO-LANE BLACKTOP Huge SIGN .in ARABIC with SADDAM’s smiling FACE. B.A. What's that sign say?
“Leaving Baghdad” I hope.

EXT. HIGHWAY - SOMEWHERE WEST OF BAGHDAD -— DAWN The 18 WHEELER limps into a US CHECKPOINT on six good tires. Eviscerated like’a whale’s carcass on the beach. IN THE CAB. Hannibal, Face, and B.A., fried. Coated in dust. No water. A bevy of Army vehicles and tanks have taken over the roa Troops swarm over to the truck as our trio climb down. Some of the troops snap salutes to the tired men. Soon, a MEDICAL EVAC CHOPPER touches down. GENERAL GARNER leaps out and hurries to our guys.
You gave me a scare.
Did we miss the war?
Just the fall of Baghdad. (then) The museum was looted. Every damn stone of it.

They didn’t get the good stuff. General Garner follows B.A., Face, and Hannibal to the BA OF THE RIG. B.A. throws OPEN the doors... A 100 POUND SAC falls out. Splits OPEN... PISTACHIOS. But NO ART. Garner looks at the three of them confused.
Where the hell is it?
Monotone, as if repeating it for the thousandth time.  19.
In the truck. Where we put it.
U.S. CENTRAL COMMAND, KUWAIT. B.A. faces a JUDGE ADVOCATE (MAJOR) while THREE MILITARY JUDGES look on.
You're telling the court it disappeared?
Things don’t just disappear.

You did. . PAN THE COURT, crowded. B.A. and FACE, up front. GENERAL GARNER, directly behind them. Hannibal looks an OFFICER, intently making NOTES on a CLIPBOARD. CID CAPTAIN TEOMAS V. LYNCH (32) tightens his square jaw as he writes. Crew cut, pug nose betray workin class Irish roots. Next to Lynch is his put-upon assistant, LIEUTENANT ANGEL SOSA, 23, Latina, stunning dark eyes. BRIEFCASE bulging with FILES.

You disappeared for twenty-four hours. Luckily, you were stopped trying to cross the Syrian border. (beat) I would like to show the court live video feed from the attack on the museum. LIGHTS OFF. ROOM goes DARK. VIDEO FILLS A COURTROOM SCREEN. Edited for effect. Artifacts loaded on the RIG. Incoming MORTAR rounds... CHINOOK evacuating the staff... HANNIBAL locking the rig' doors... The rig driving away. .

The lights come back on. JUDGE ADVOCATE (CONT‘D) Colonel Smith, you were ordered to evacuate with your men. You disobeyed those orders and stayed behind. ‘Operation Friends of Liberty’ was your chance for larceny. You planned it all along, didn’t you?  20.
As a soldier, you learn the same lesson over and over. Nothing ever comes together the way you plan it. The Judge Advocate walks back. Stops. Turns.
One last question. Isn’t it true you majored in art history? Hannibal just stares at the guy, his face going hot. LATER: B.A. sits on the stand.

sgt. Bosco Arnold Baracas was offered leniency to testify against Colonel Smith. He refused. (a dramatic beat) Now I offer it one last time. Tell us what Colonel smith did with the artifacts, and you can avoid prison. B.A. locks eyes with the Advocate. B.A. You want me. to lie to save my ass. That’s old army, sir. I’m new army. Army of one. Hannibal smiles.

Suit yourself. Not everyone is as stubborn or as stupid as you. The Judge Advocate’s eyes move to Face, who looks down, shamed. LATER: Face is on the stand, looking squeamish. He won’t make eye contact with Hannibal or B.A. JUDGE ADVOCATE (CONT‘D) Did you or did you not see Colonel John Smith and Sergeant Baracus switch out the trailer with the stolen goods: The advocate leans in, gently, like a father...
(whispers) He can’t get to you if you tell the truth.
ee  21. Face nods, like he’s troubled... but then he sets his jaw like he's going to do what's right. He locks eyes with Hannibal...
T can't lie for you anymore, Colonel... Hannibal stands up...
You goddam Benedict Arnold... The JUDGE is banging the gavel, trying to get control of these proceedings.
That’s enough!
(still to Hannibal) Just tell ‘em where you buried the art. Hannibal sits down, stunned, realizing he’s been played.

No further questions. Face stands up and starts to be led away, close to the table holding the defendants... Suddenly, Hannibal launches for Face, even cuffed... B.A. does the same, fighting through the MPs who are tryi to restrain him... It's a melee in the cozy confines of the courtroom... as Hannibal knocks Face to the ground...
Get ‘em off me! Finally, the MPs get Hannibal and B.A. restrained. Face gets up, breathing hard. We don’t think there’s going to be any more said, but...

I told ‘em what I know, Colonel... That's it! Hannibal launches again, but this time the MPs pull them in opposite directions. As they’re being pushed toward doorways on either end of the corridor, Hannibal kicking the whole way, B.A.  22. turns and gives Face one last death stare. Lynch watches the whole time, making notes. *
HANNIBAL and B.A. stand in front of the judge, Face
conspicuously missing now. *

On the twenty-six felony counts, the court finds you guilty as charged. You will serve two years on each count to run consecutively. BANG, gavel down. CAPTAIN LYNCH is suddenly standing righ in front of Hannibal.
We were railroaded. And woulda been found guilty even without Peck’s testimony.
You were given a fair trial. He reaches out. Takes OFF Hannibal’s SPECIAL FORCES PIN. An insult, and a humiliation.
I‘1l be coming for that.
Somehow I don’t think you will. Hannibal just stares at him while he is led away. *

head_text.subj: STEEL GRATE OVER A DIRTY WINDOW,

text: INTO FRAME: HANNIBAL, peeking outside. WIDEN. INT./EXT. MP BUS - U.S. ARMY BASE — DAY Crossing the immense BASE on its own HIGHWAY, heavy with TRAFFIC. B.A. and HANNIBAL, the only ones inside.
BUS passes family HOUSING, SHOPPING CENTERS, an active AIRPORT... But Hannibal is staring at the flat-roofed PRISON COMPLEX in the distance. Three PERIMETERS of WIRE.  23.
BUS doors OPEN. B.A. steps down first. HANNIBAL behind him, his hands manacled and legs chained. LIEUTENANT SOSA is waiting for them with an ARMED MP escort.
Point the way, Sergeant.
The: prisoner will remain silent while being processed. B.A. You're addressing a colonel in the United States Special Forces.

I‘m addressing prisoner number 709821. INT. ‘C’ DORMITORY - HANNIBAL’S CELL - DAY 6 x 10 cinder block. Vertical WINDOW. Steel TOILET. Hannibal arranges a few BOOKS, MAGAZINES. Sits on his cot with a NEWSPAPER, as the DOOR OPENS. An MP GUARD shouts.
Attention. Hannibal stands easily. CAPTAIN LYNCH strides in, plants his feet. Same CLIPBOARD we saw at the trial.

The prisoner's reading privileges have been rescinded. He snatches the newspaper from Hannibal’s hands. LYNCH (CONT’D) Ditto all mail privileges. You will be limited to a single, half hour yard break. Visits to the library, weight room, and TV room are cancelled until. further notice. Non-essential conversation curtailed.
You sure seem to be taking this personally. Lynch lifts the clipboard, jots a note. Makes Hannibal feel like he’s with the principal.  24.

Maybe I'm an art lover. Maybe I get squeamish at the thought of priceless artifacts buried somewhere in the Iraqi desert, stolen for personal profit by a traitor to his uniform. Maybe I get a little piqued at every news channel and paper back home calling the army I love and respect and have dedicated my life to a bunch of incompetent, amoral idiots for allowing the Iraqi National Museum to get looted. Or maybe I just don’t like you.
That’s a lot of maybes. Long beat.
Enjoy your day, prisoner. He turns and leaves. Hannibal gets up and moves to the door...

Can I at least have a cigar... But all he gets is HEELS CLICKING down the hallway. INT. PRISON CAFETERIA — DAWN HANNIBAL slides along the COUNTER with his tray. Watches KITCHEN WORKER spoon gray OATMEAL into a bowl.
{looks at bowl) Okay, I give up. What is it?
Jogging with other PRISONERS around the YARD. Drenched in sweat. Passing men ten years younger. .
LYNCH adjusts MOUNTED FIELD GLASSES.
Give him just enough privileges to get comfortable and then take them away one by one. (MORE)
Eventually, he’1l tell us what we need to know for the puff of one cigar. Sosa looks over at B.A. in another section of the yard.
What about the sergeant?
He doesn’t know dick. Let him rot.
Yes, sir. Lynch looks over at Sosa...
By the way... I sent your reference out to General Tasker. I let him know I am considering giving you advanced responsibility on this. She lowers’ the binocs.
I appreciate that, sir. ---and we...
HANNIBAL finds B.A. playing with a family of mangy FERAL CATS.. Hannibal squats, a huge TABBY brushes back and for against his leg. Meows like he demands attention.
Where'd you come from tough guy? B.A. They move back and forth, from the prison, to the town. Seein’ who’ll feed them the most.

Smart puss. Hannibal scoops the tabby up and scratches its belly till it purrs. He puts it down and starts jogging again...  26. INT. HANNTBAL’S CELL - NIGHT Hannibal sews a TORN SHIRT while Lynch finishes making notes in his clipboard.
If you’re waiting for me to break, you might want to buy a recliner and settle in.
Tell us where you buried the art and T’1l get you better food, transfer to a nicer base, better climate...
I buried it in your mother’s —-
(cutting him off)

The MP GUARD appears. Swipes a CELL CARD to open the LOCK LYNCH (CONT’D) Keep it up. It’1l just make it all the more satisfying to watch you crack. Lynch moves off. The MP GUARD LOCKS the cell again. I was getting worried.
Not as worried as I am.

sides and After you find the vase, get across the Turkish border. I’11 have a chopper waiting to pull you out. The court will have to overturn your charges. (pointed) Be careful, Hannibal, the guy who's going to slam the knife in your back is usually standing right next to you. Just then, Face pops his head out...
You ready?
(into the phone) Message received, sir. He hangs up and steps with Face back into a...
A crooked ceiling FAN goes thwap-thwap. Murdock and B.A. are wearing CUSTOMS uniforms. Face is in a Hannibal is wearing a dark suit.

(to B.A. and Murdock) full tuxedo. Wait for my signal. Then board strong. Seize the vase. Arrest us. Get off fast. We need to be long gone before Grushko knows who we are. And tap that radar tower. I don’t want any surprises. B.A. I bet cover boy will provide the surprises. Meaning Face, who is brushing his hair in the mirror. Fac stops in mid-preen, turns, and walks over to B.A. gets in his face.  54.

You know what, Bosco? I’m getting tired of the accusations. B.A. looks like he’s ready to rip him limb from limb... their noses inches apart. FACE (CONT’D) I know I didn’t swipe the art. I'm pretty sure the Colonel didn’t swipe the art. Loony Tunes wasn’t there. . The only thing I’m not sure about is what hand you played in this. : B.A. You finished?

It depends. B.A. Then let me tell you something, Face-man. There are nine commandments in the Bible that I try to live by. “Thou shalt not steal” is something Mrs. Baracas taught me when I was a pup and I’ve never broken it. Murdock pipes up...
Aren’t there ten commandments? B.A. I tend to look past the one about not killing. Especially when we’re talking about rats. He and Face are still eye to eye. Hannibal finishes tying his tie.

Enough. They'll be plenty of time to kill each other later. Right now, let’s save it for the Russians. And with that, we cut to... EXT. ON THE DOCK - NEAR THE GORKY -— DAY A shiny black QUATTROPORTE stops. HANNIBAL watches the Gorky for a moment. Face and Hannibal get out.  55.
You’re just leaving the car? It cost me a Rolex to bribe the dealer.
A knock off, right? Face starts to deny it, then smiles. Hannibal is already walking away. ON THE GANGWAY. Hannibal whispers last minute instruction to Face.
When the auction starts, don’t do anything to signal a bid. Don’t cough, scratch your ear, smile.
Don’t worry about me.
And Grushko has a wife. I don’t know what's Russian for ‘Pet of the Year’ but if she drops a napkin, walk away. Don‘t even look at her.
What year was she? SECURITY MEN in tuxedos frisk them as they step on board.
Appointed in teak and brass. Attractive RUSSIAN HOSTESSES serve well-dressed MEN and WOMEN, Grushko’s clients. Face enters with Hannibal, like he’s the buyer and Hannibal's his assistant.
There it is. A SPOTLIGHT hits a TABLE. Draped in black velvet. The GOLD VASE. HANNIBAL (CONT‘D) Keep an eye out for Grushko.
De we know what he looks like?
Like dirty money.  56. Face locks eyes with a BLONDE (20's), legs so long they seem to bestride the world. She makes a beeline for Face.
(Russian accent) Are you as bored as I am?
Not anymore. She sips from a flute of champagne. Face suddenly realize her OTHER hand is IN his pocket.
I misplaced my hotel keys in your pocket.
If I find them, I‘11 run them over to you tonight. Hannibal pulls, leading Face away. FACE (CONT’D) Hey. It’s a party. I’m being social.
It's a mission. You’re being suicidal. A_short MAN. with the pallor of a vampire blocks their wa DIMITRI GRUSHKO, 40‘s, kinky black hair, dead black eyes, fake smile.
I see you’ve met my wife.
Yeah... she’s uh...
i don’t know you.
You don’t need to know me. You just need to know my black American Express.
Really? He laughs dryly, like he’s not really amused.
- Tell me one thing you own. Something impossible.
Hannibal sees several SECURITY MEN close in. For a second we don’t think Face is going to answer. Then...

I bought the original sketch for Ren and Stimpy. Grushko stares. Hannibal is sure Face has just gotten the killed. Just when we think that’s all he’s got... FACE (CONT’D) Which I traded for Maradona’s cleats from the 1994 World Cup. I turned that for a small painting of St. Francis that turned out to be a Zubaran stolen from the Prado. , Grushko expression is slowly turning into a smile...

Flipped that for twelve Mark Rothko’s stolen from his Soho loft. Which let me finance the Gardner Museum theft in Boston. Which got me my first Leonardo. Don’t you hate the riff raff calling him "DaVinei'? Grushko laughs a belly life.
Okay, friend. A collector like you will be satisfied here. Grushko leaves with his wife.
shit.
What?
We’re moving. B.A. (two-way) You‘re moving.
Massive engines are churning water. The GORKY is pulling away form the dock. ON B.A. AND MURDOCK. B.A. starts loping down the dock.

(two-way) Got it. All right. Find something that floats and follow us out. We stick with the plan. WITH B.A. AND MURDOCK. Moving to a BULGARIAN CUSTOMS HSV (High Speed Vessel). Mounted 50mm. TWO JET SKIS at back. B.A. Can you drive this boat?

These things are fast. I like fast. MURDOCK jumps on board, moves into the CABIN. Starts the supercharged engines. A SHOUT below. A BULGARIAN CUSTOMS OFFICER lumbers up, just awake. B.A. grabs his wrist, pulls him out... flips him overboard. B.A. Move us out. WIDEN. Murdock maneuvers the HSV into the HARBOR. Immediately clips the back of a KETCH, over-corrects, caroms off a POWER BOAT...
Thought you could drive this thing.
I’m directionally challenged. B.-A. gets in his face. B.A. My foot‘’s about to be directionally challenged.

Take it easy, sergeant. Maybe you’d like some of my medications... they’1ll-sort out your anger issue... ° B.A. (interrupts) My cousin Jamal? So whacked-out nobody ever bothered him. Till we realized he was picking off our girlfriends behind our backs, like a dog. You can’t bullshit me. You ain‘t crazy. . But Murdock is watching something LAND IN THE HARBOR. A AMPHIBIOUS SEAPLANE, huge, majestic.

Whoa... check it out. A Beriev Be-200 Flying Boat. Hclds eighty people. You can. fly around the world and never need an airport. Murdock bursts into happy tears. . MURDOCK (CONT ’D) I dreamed that plane before they built it. B.A. Never mind. I take it all back.
Face watches Hannibal, by the VASE. Studying it. GRUSHKO holds up his hands at the front.

Ladies and gentlemen. Lately, I've become dead to. the beauty of what I sell. My eyes only see money... (with emotion) Today, I am born again. Today I offer you what I believe is man’s first great work of art. Bids begin at one hundred million euros. A GERMAN DEALER calls out.
Verify its provenance. Grushko aims a REMOTE. PUNCH ON SCREEN. DR.  AL-MAHDT, wide-eyed. The shot is CLOSE UP, so he can’t see where Al Mahdi is. :
You all know Dr. Al-Mahdi and trust his opinion. (to screen) Professor, tell my clients what you see. Al-Mahdi‘’s face is rigid, fighting fear.
This is the golden vase displayed in the great hall of the Iraqi National Museum. Hannibal leans close to Face.  60.
(softly) I need to see if Al-Mahdi is on board. Face nods.

head_text.subj: FOLLOW HANNIBAL ALONG THE MAIN DECK RAIL,

text: Down a STAIRWAY to the SECOND DECK. Through a TEAK DOOR.. into the SECOND DECK CORRIDOR. STATE ROOMS on each side. Hannibal checks the first. Sumptuous, but EMPTY.
(suddenly on two-way) Hannibal, Grushko is heading for the Russian side of the lake. :
If there’s trouble, they’1l provide back up for him. Give me five minutes.
(two-way ) You might not have five minutes.
He‘s snuck: out to the rail.
(into his phone) Where are you?
LYNCH on his mobile. SOSA points to the GPS SCREEN.
{into phone) We're turning south... just minutes away.
Do not move in until I have the vase.
Trying the last door. This one is LOCKED. Hannibal forces it. Steps inside...

Converted to a work room. SATELLITE RECEIVER. LAP TOP MONITOR. ... CLOSER ON MONITOR. AL-MAHDI, tele-conference in from SOMEWHERE ELSE. EVEN CLOSER. Al-Mahdi sits on a folding chair, in an empt room, cinder block walls. SILHOUETTE OF A MAN O.S. with a
RIFLE, a shadow on the wal] behind Al-Mahdi... *
(two-way) He’s not here. B.A. (two-way ) See if you can source the data-stream...

Listen to you... B.A. I got talents you don’t even know about... Hannibal is still watching the monitor... Al-Mahdi starts to get out of his chair and a hand reaches into the frame and pushes him back down. Hannibal focuses in on that hand... te,

Just then, a security guard enters, looks at Hannibal. Th longest SECOND in history. Both startled. The GUARD reaches in his tuxedo for a PISTOL, but Hanniba pulls him into the room by his gun hand. The Guard kicks out Hannibal’s knee, dropping him. An elbow to the Guard’s stomach bends him over. Hannibal slaps the GUN free and it skitters UNDER the equipment. CLOSE-IN FIGHTING. Hannibal springs to his feet. Trades vicious blows with the Guard, then snatches up the lap to and swings it like a baseball bat right into the guard’s face. Crack! The Guard drops flat. Hannibal leaves quickly, locking the door behind.
Face steps inside. Looks for Hannibal.
The bid is one hundred and twenty million euros. Do I have one-thirty? A portly CHINESE BILLIONAIRE flicks his wrist.
(points to nim) One hundred and thirty million Euros. Face'is sure SECURITY MEN are staring at him. He checks his watch anxiously. Hannibal appears alongside.
(two-way ) Hannibal, a Russian patrol ship is hauling ass your way.
{ two-way) Board. .

He can see a RUSSIAN NAVY BOAT speeding into view. B.A. (calls to the cabin) Murdock! Sound the siren. Let them know we're boarding. B.A. looks around. Murdock is not on the ship. B.A. (CONT’D) Murdock? He zeroes in on the spot where the two jet-skis were... because one of them is now conspicuously gone. BACK TO COMMON ROOM. Face keeps looking outside.
(auction continues) The bid is one hundred and thirty million Euros. Do I have one-sixty? Anyone else? Once? Twice?
(to Face) Buy it. Face nods, raises a HAND.
| (points at Face) One hundred and sixty million Euros. Do I have one-eighty?. Anyone? This is a bargain. (beat) (MORE)
“once. Twice... The bidding is closed. Bravo. Grushko picks up the VASE and carries it to Face while th guests applaud. Places it in his arms.
Of course, we need a bank confirmation. If you’1l come with me. Grushko directs Face to a TABLE with a solid gold PHONE. Hannibal acts like he’s Face’s assistant...
I’d use the Bahamian bank, sir. The Swiss are so lethargic. Face picks up the phone, trying to stall...

Did you bring my glasses, Reginald? WIDEN, as the SIREN of the CUSTOMS BOAT, loud and shrill, penetrates the room. The GUESTS are immediately freaked. FACE (CONT‘D) What’s going on here? Grushko calmly signals a GUARD. Puts his hand on Face’s shoulder, pressing him into the seat.
We will handle it. Call.
Grushko has perfected a way of smiling that seems like a death sentence.

B.A. powers down the HSV, but not nearly enough. He slams INTO the GANGWAY, caroms into the hull. ON HANNIBAL, as the collision rocks the boat. Grushko shouts something in Russian to his men. The yacht’s huge ENGINES suddenly kick up a strong wake. The Gorky starts moving away from the CUSTOMS BOAT. B.A. (into two-way) He’s running for his Russian friends. Hannibal can feel the boat moving.  64.

Relax, ladies and yentlemen, we are simply adjusting our position. A SECURITY GUARD appears. Whispers in Grushko’s ear.’ His eyes are pure steel as they turn on Hannibal. Hannibal takes the VASE, hurls it across the ROOM. GUESTS scream. The GUARDS jump for it... too late. The VASE explodes into SHARDS. GRUSHKO (CONT’D) What have you done?!

(announces } It’s the display vase from the museum. A fake. Our friend here was scamming his clients. And the CLIENTS know now. They all grab their CELL PHONES screaming for their private yachts. Grushko reaches for a small, gold WALTHER HAND GUN. Hannibal’s fist fires like a piston to his gut as the gun FIRES. Face pushes his way through the ensuing chaos... ALONG THE RAIL. Face sees the CHINOOK moving in. He calls LYNCH.
(on his phone) It‘s a fake. I repeat the vase here is a fake.
Skimming over the water towards the GORKY. SOSA watches the yacht in her FIELD GLASSES. LYNCH is putting a clip into his M16 as he hears Face’s VOICE.
(over the intercom) And right now it’s in a million fake pieces. tynch shakes his head, pissed. The pressure getting to him...
(roars) Goddammit! (to Face) (MORE)

Okay... don’t leave the colonel’s side * till you locate the art. (to Sosa) Abort. Turn back... Face keeps moving along the rail as he sees the CHINOOK turn back. . FIND HANNIBAL. Looking for Face. A SECURITY GUARD challenges him. Hannibal flips him over the rail. INTERCUT: B.A., steering the HSV alongside the GORKY. B.A. (two-way) Port side. B.A. looks through field glasses. Ball of SMOKE from the RUSSIAN SHIP. Delayed ECHO. PUNCH WIDER. A 50 MM SHELL explodes close enough to the HSV to shower B.A. with seawater. Hannibal appears with FACE.
What the hell have we gotten into?
Right now... the water. He spins Face into a full Nelson, and bulls him OVER THE RAIL... They drop hard into the sea.

B.A. veers the HSV to Hannibal. Pulls him and Face inside Turns sharply away from the Gorky. The HSV increases speed. Tries to out-run the Russian ship... RUSSIAN GUNFIRE traces across the water in front them. B.A. turns the HSV sharply. Just then The FLYING BOAT drops from the sky. Sending up wall of spray. Coasts alongside. HOLD OPENS. MURDOCK, peers out.
It’s a boat, it’s a plane... it’s a party on wings. Hannibal leaps on the strut. Pulls Face inside.
Murdock runs to the cockpit. But B.A. is still on the iaunch.
Get on. B.A. is frozen. B.A. Can't. Move. The RUSSIANS are coming round for another attack.
Let him swim. Take off. Hannibal looks at B.A., extends his hand.
Good luck, soldier. B.A. Thank you, sir. B.A. clasps his hand into Hannibal's, but Hannibal locks on. B.A. realizes he isn‘t letting go... just as...

»..Hannibal has B.A. dangling in the air, murder in his eyes. Just as the: RUSSIANS launch a shell. It EXPLODES, destroying the CUSTOMS BOAT in a huge fireball, right beneath B.A.‘s feet. Hannibal pulls B.A. in the rest of the way, where he just collapses on the plane's floor.

I just saved your life, sergeant. Yet, you look annoyed. B.A. shuts his eyes... B.A. Don’t talk to me. ON GENERAL GARNER - FOB ‘THUNDER’ - DAY He scurries in the shadow of a building. Choppers land an take off in the b.g.  67.
(into mobile) So you almost died and ended up with nothing to show for it.
Hannibal in the cockpit beside Murdock.
(into mobile) Oh, we got something. ...-a shadow on a wall. Holding « gun on Dr. Al-Mahdi. A Special Forces soldier.
All our men are at war.
Not the ones who carry custom-made M- l6a‘s...
The outline of an M16A..-

And have Green Lake insignia’s on their sleeves... FLASHBACK: THAT HAND PUSHING AL-MAHDI DOWN... now we ZOOM IN CLOSER and can see _a tiny “GLS” sewn into the cuff. W didn’t notice it before, but Hannibal sure did.
I’m going straight to Green Lake.
Dangerous move, Hannibal.
If I find Al-Mahdi, I find the museum artifacts. Garner blows out a deep breath... then...
I know they run security for the Dubai Tower. Biggest in the world.
It's a. fortress, Hannibal... a well- funded, well-protected death trap. (MORE)

You can’t do it alone. Do you have an “AY level team? Hannibal turns and looks around the plane. ... INTO POV: B.A. with his eyes shut. FACE, brushing his mussed hair. And MURDOCK, swatting wildly around his head at imaginary bugs... . Hannibal just shakes his head.
(back to Garner) I definitely have a team.
INT. SOSA’S OFFICE - DAY Sosa is watching her PRINTER spew out typed pages. The DOOR OPENS. LYNCH, steps in. He‘s brought a file folder in and sets them on her desk. She flips through the files...
Sir, you didn't sign these reports.
Just sign for me.
Yes, sir. But... well, this is a paper trail. Literally.

Means go away when the ends are good. (then, a smile) I’ve got everyone at the Pentagon and half of Congress calling for some sort of symbol we can show the world that we actually give a damn about these people we're liberating. I guarantee they don’t” care how we recover the artifacts, just that we do it.
Yes, sir. Also... um... you said I’d be given more responsibility...
Colonel Smith broke out so that he could off-load those goods... we stay close and he‘1l lead us right to them. (beat) (MORE )
Check in with Peck. That is your responsibility.
Yes, sir. Bur I'd like to talk about the direction... But he‘s already walking away, not interested...
As his eyes flicker AWAKE. He sits up...— WIDEN. A small, dumpy BEDROOM. Curtains closed. Dark. Hears a VOICE from behind a SLIDING DOOR. B.A. stands up. Listens.
(whispered, intense) I'm saying I want to set some things straight. In person. B.A. opens the door. Steps onto a wrap-around BALCONY. Sunlight almost blinding. FACE snaps his cell phone shut.
A MOTEL on the outskirts of a smog enshrouded CITY. B.A. Who were you talking to?
(challenging) My mother. B.A. looks at him for a long second, then... FACE (CONT‘D) You want to say something? B.A. I don’t make cracks about people'‘s mothers.
Is that another commandment? He looks over to see Murdock is perched like a bird on th railing to the deck. B.A. It should be.  .70. Just then, Hannibal steps out on the porch...

Where are we now and what are we doing here, sir? Hannibal walks to the rail. Points. The others join him looking out at... Pov: LONG SHOT - DUBAI TOWER Even at this distance the tower looms over the city. United Arab Emirates’ contestant for the tallest structur on the planet.
Only this time we’re looking UP at it from the STREET. Miles of glass WINDOWS. WIND howls around it. The team walks by and disappears inside...
Hannibal, Murdock, Face and B.A. at a TABLE. Hannibal set down the TRAY and stacks HAMBURGERS into a tower.

Green Lake occupies floors 102 through 104. They use internal Wi-Fi to link the offices. But one office has a separate secure system. (finger on his tower) Here. Classified information. A guard stays on the steel door, 24/7. Ex- Special Forces. Required to sweep the room for bugs every five minutes. And there’s always a suit on the desk. That's two we have to handle. (to B.A.) How long would you need access to get into these files? B.A. After I’m locked on? Four, five minutes. But I’d have to be close.
How close?
On the business side of that steel door with a relay link to the outside of the building. :
What are you going to do, Colonel? Walk right in and ring the bell? Hannibal grabs a handful of fries, smiles.
Green Lake wants me. They can have me.
Refined, Yankee features. Dashes in from her garden to catch the KITCHEN phone. Sprawling, designer house.
Hello?
Taken back. Her VOICE freezes him.
Who is this? WIDEN. EXT. DUBAI —- STREET - DAY Hannibal tries to remember why this seemed a good idea.
Don’t hang up, Elizabeth. Elizabeth's face goes through a series of emotions: recognition, wonder, rattled, pissed off.
Jesus. Hannibal? |

What’s it been, six years? She looks through a picture window. A MAN, chinos, docksiders, plays with TWO small BOYS. GWEN (CONT’D) HANNIBAL (unraveled) Great to hear your voice. I can’t talk to you.  72. Awkward, then.
T need a favor.
Friends ask for favors.
We weren’t friends?
We were married. But friends? I never received that honor. On shaky ground, he tries another tack.
How’s your son?
Sons. Three of them. Another shock.
Really. Wow. That’s, well, must be a lot of work for you.
Arthur always takes paternity leave. To be here for me. Everyday.
Is that the good part or the bad part? She just waits... HANNIBAL (CONT’D) I‘m happy for you Elizabeth. Elizabeth's voice softens.
I’m happy, too.
Hey, question. Lousy transition, and he knows it.
What’s the chance of you sending a FAX for me? On your personal bank stationery? To Dubai?  73.
You don't care how I am.
You’re reacting like a cynic.
I had a good teacher. Good-bye, Hannibal.
Wait. Please, Elizabeth. I really need your help.
He’s waiting, waiting, waiting... and before we hear her answer, we...

OFFICE WORKERS, SHOPPERS move in and out. UAE FEDERAL POLICE keep traffic moving. A-VAN stops. B.A. drives. DOOR OPENS. MURDOCK steps out. Suit, tie, maybe a little dishevelled. Briefcase. He looks at the entrance, stops. Swallows hard.
What's the problem, Captain?
I... uh... heh-neh... it’s nothing. They watch Murdock stride towards the entrance. B.A. . Only one reason why people pretend to be shit-bird crazy. ‘Cause they scared to go into battle.
He doesn't seem scared to me. B.A. Then you got no clue what he’s gonna do.
That's right. And neither do they.  74.

Sprawling, gleaming. A tasteful SECURITY CHECK POINT run by UAE POLICE. Black goatees. Professional. Murdock freezes. He has to pass his BRIEFCASE through a METAL DETECTOR. . He wipes sweat from his cheek. Steps through. Closes his eyes as. the BRIEFCASE glides through. Nothing set off. A particularly large UAE GUARD watches Murdock intently. All the way to the ELEVATORS.
Murdock waits in a crowd. Seems like forever. Finally, DOORS OPEN. Everyone else steps ON. Murdock is left alone. Appears like he’s going to implode.

(two-way ) On your way up, captain? Murdock steps ON. Just as DOORS CLOSE... REVERSE ANGLE. HANNIBAL, passing through the METAL DETECTORS. Under the fierce gaze of the UAE GUARDS. Hannibal continues to an ELEVATOR. Steps ON.

Packed. Hannibal looks UP. A SECURITY CAMERA is set . inside the ceiling. MATCH TO FISH EYE SHOT OF HANNIBAL. Staring at the SECURITY CAMERA. We can HEAR the clicking sounds of a DIGITAL PHOTO rendered.
Okay, they got me. PUNCH: GREEN LAKE. SECURITY AREA. A computer MONITOR. HANNIBAL’S PHOTO appears. Matched against one in the
A low BEEP brings over a GUARD (34, ex-Ranger, Okie accent). He looks at Hannibal's PHOTO. Calls over the SECURITY SUIT (call him DANTELS).  75.
We got a match. It’s flagged.
Call Pike. I’m gonna make a sweep. The Okie picks up a phone...
Pike sits in the front of a helicopter traveling over Dubai. He gets the call over his headset and clicks it through...
This is Pike. {he listens, incredulous) Hannibal smith -s in the tower!? IN THE SKY, the helicopter makes a sharp bank and heads f the massive tower in the distance...
Sprawling, busy. Large art-directed POSTERS flaunt Green Lake's services. Saving the world. A pretty European RECEPTIONIST, at a desk, suddenly notices MURDOCK, lookin around.
Can I help you? Murdock adjusts his tie.
(mumbles ) I, um... need to... see someone. It’s very... important. The Receptionist touches a SECURITY ALERT on her desk.
Do you have an appointment, sir? Murdock’s eyes widen.
Yes. I believe I do. I mean, I think I do.
INTERCUT: B.A. AND FACE. Parked on a SIDE STREET just OUTSIDE the TOWER. They HEAR it all. : B.A. (two-way) He's the Titanic, Hannibal.
(two-way ) We're all going down. TO HANNIBAL. | Stepping OFF the ELEVATOR on ANOTHER FLOOR
* (two-way) Give him a chance. BACK TO MURDOCK. Daniels appears.
Can I see ID, sir?
I don’t understand. Don’t you know who I am? Daniels puts his hand firmly on Murdock’s elbow.
Come with me. Murdock is losing his nerve fast. His mouth suddenly dry as sand. Voice trembling.

I’m Edward Althorp. I‘m expected. Daniels starts to pull Murdock along. Away from the publi spaces. TO HANNIBAL. Listening in. Stops at a STATRWAY DOOR. BACK TO MURDOCK. - Dragged around corners, far into the b by Daniels. Daniels punches a KEYPAD at the STEEL SECURIT DOOR. Pulls Murdock INSIDE...
Daniels sets Murdock in a seat. Turns a chair facing him.
I want to know who you are. And I want the truth.
Murdock blinks. What a time to be perfectly sane. Knowing he’s going to fail.
I‘m... Edward... Althorp. I’m... expected. Daniels smirks.

Well this is going to be fun... He gets up and takes off his jacket, cracks a knuckle, an right then... : STEEL DOOR OPENS again. A handsome WOMAN (ARCHER, 40's, business suit, frosted hair) pops through.
(out of breath) Mr. Althorp? Murdock’s eyes slowly focus on her.
Yes. She shoots a disapproving grimace at Daniels.
(embarrassed) I’m Ms. Archer... We just received your FAX. I’m so sorry. A big misunderstanding. Daniels senses he’s in deep shit.
I guess I didn’t understand... who you were, are,... Murdock jumps to his feet. The ‘character’ flooding into his being. As it often does. He erupts in a torrent of words.

(strong Boston accent) MIT. Discrete Probability Distribution in Information Systems. Getting by on sixty K. Who can live on sixty K? Patches on the patches on my tweed jackets. Six floor walk up in Brookline. Burning rent. Wext thing I know, he’s in my office. Couldn’t remember his name. (MORE)

I. have so many former students. He’s at the Pentagon. Said they used my system for security. Wanted to outsource work to my company. I did have a company, didn’t I? All I had was a Honda Civic. Said my first contract was small. A hundred million. ... Four years later, we ~ go public. Now the numbers all start with a ‘B’. And I need to outsource my outsource work. That’s why I came to Green Lake. I thought I’d be treated with respect. Daniels has shriveled.
I'm setting up the meeting now, sir. In the meantime, Mr. Daniels will bring you tea.
That‘1l1 be fine. They both leave. Murdock waits, opens his BRIEFCASE. Takes out a WIRELESS RADIO RELAY. Peels off sticky-strips Sets it on the wall behind a CABINET.
- (two-way) The tap-is open.
Hannibal hurries through the FIRE DOOR and reaches the ne landing. The first thing he sees is a 9mm pointing at his face. The OKIE GUARD throws him against the wall.-
. (acting befuddled) I think I’m lost.
Shut up. OKIE bends Hannibal’s arms back. Ties on plastic CUFFS.
One of many TOWER DECKS. The guard has to use a SECURITY CARD to get them out there. Hannibal is shoved outside toward a railing.
Are we going somewhere?
Hannibal back to the railing where he slips a small disc the size of a quarter from his pocket. He sticks it to th railing...

Short chopper ride over to Kuwait. Ever see what happens to a body in the desert? No need to bury it. After a day or two, it’s gone. Even the bones. IN THE VAN, B.A.’s laptop lights up, connected. But the signal is weak. B.A. _ I gotta get closer. He jumps out of the van with a BACKPACK. Looks around. Raises an ANTENNA in the pack. Attached to a small HARD DRIVE. Face slides behind the wheel. B.A. (CONT‘D) (looks back at Face) Five minutes.
I'll be here. B.A. heads for the LOBBY. As soon as B.A. is. gone, Face slams the gas pedal. Rockets away.
